oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gender Issues in K-12 Educational Leadership
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanchez, Dr. Jafeth E.
Thornton, Dr. Bill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper serves as a review of the research literature on gender issues in K-12 educational leadership, with a primary focus on the principal and superintendency positions in the United States. The prominent common themes or topics found in the literature are discussed. More specifically, barriers to gender equity in educational leadership are identified, and qualities or strategies used by successful female administrators where such barriers have been broken are noted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Education Leadership Research Center, Texas A&M University
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Advancing Women in Leadership Journal; Vol. 30 (2010)
